intro: Isopogon robustus, commonly known as the robust isopogon, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing a dense canopy that supports a variety of wildlife. Isopogon robustus is well adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its natural habitat.
